creator: MSU-Factory
title: Clap Controlled Light Switch
materials_required: Electret Mic Amp MAX4466 w/ Adjustable Gain
9V Battery Snap Connector to DC Male Power Adapter Cables for Arduino
description: This project creates a clap-controlled light switch using an Arduino, a microphone, and a servo motor. The system detects claps and uses the servo to toggle the light switch.
steps: Connect the Arduino to the breadboard and supply power.
Connect the Servo motor to the breadboard for power and connect the signal pin to pin 9 on the Arduino.
Connect the Mic output pin to pin A0 on the Arduino, VCE to positive power, and GND to ground.
Connect a 300-600 Ohm resistor between pin 2 on the Arduino and the positive side of the LED, then connect the other end of the LED to ground.
Download and open the Arduino software and connect the Arduino Uno to the computer using a USB cable.
Select the correct board and USB port in the Arduino software.
Upload the provided code to the Arduino board.
Adjust the 'trigger' value in the code to change the microphone sensitivity.
Adjust the 'timeout' value to change the time between claps that are detected.
Create a mount to hold all the components, including the Arduino, breadboard, and battery.
Attach the servo to the mount so it can turn the light switch using an arm.
Attach the servo arm to the servo spoke and the light switch, potentially using zip ties.
Mount the system above the light switch using Velcro or a similar method.
Adjust the system to ensure it properly toggles the light switch with claps.
